response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for cProfile Code with pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer details the methods to integrate cProfile with pytest for profiling Python 3.12+ code, ensuring efficient testing of performance-critical applications.
key_points: Understand the need for profiling in optimizing Python code
Familiarize yourself with cProfile and its capabilities
Learn how to use pytest fixtures for executing cProfile
Explore options for displaying and analyzing the collected data

code_examples.code:
import cProfile
import pstats
def test_profiled_data(capsule):
    pr = cProfile.run("test()", sort='cumulative')
p = pstats.Stats(pr)
    capsule.add(p.sort_stats('cumulative').dumpstats())

version_notes: Pytest version 7.2.0 and above is required for using fixtures
Python 3.12.x is the minimum supported version for this demonstration
caveats: Be aware that profiling can have performance overhead, so avoid running it on actual tests
